very very silly question! They all have very different ''optimal'' situations...
a bit like asking ''what's the best desk editor'' or ''what's the best distro''. try to say what you expect to do with it. Like filesystem size, type of PC, files, ...
for example, XFS is best for very large RAID storage systems, ReiserFS for lots of very small files, and so on...
how large? Just your own PC, desktop usage? Do you dual boot to MS Windows?
however the usual general ''all purpose'' filesystems are 'ext3' and JFS. I think that JFS is somewhat better performance than 'ext3'. However 'ext3' is MS Windows compatible.
